page.title: 17 Talking To Pig Farmers
page.content: We visited a small pig farm along the A163 Market Weighton Road. A farm worker told us that there were over 100 pigs. Only a few go to slaughter. The farmer takes 1 or 2 to the cattle market at 14 weeks old. An average litter is 12 piglets. The pigs are fed on fish and barley. Further down the road at the Dutch Pig Farm, we asked similar questions. The farm has about 60 piglets born and around the same number going to slaughter each week. The pigs are pure breed, large white, land race and cross breed. The oldest pig is an 8 year old sow. Farm machinery includes a Bob Cat tractor, slurry tanker, power washer and scraping machinery. A worker said he put a 40 hour week, plus overtime. Savage sows were a problem!
